main event: A 15-year-old student observed a round, red and white object the size of a dime traveling west and straight up for three minutes in Glennavon, California, in July 1955.
interesting points: The object was reported to travel faster than jet aircraft., The observer noted that the size of the object appeared to be like a dime held at arm's length., The sighting was recorded as being longer than four minutes long across two separate observations., The observer is the same in both reports, indicating a consistency in sightings., Headquarters concluded there was insufficient data to evaluate the sighting accurately.
sighted object: one round, red and white object
